metadata.title: CVE-2020-12761 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
modules/loaders/loader_ico.c in imlib2 1.6.0 has an integer overflow (with resultant invalid memory allocations and out-of-bounds reads) via an icon with many colors in its color map.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-12761` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libimlib2 - 1.6.1-2
No subscription required

notes.note: leosilva> introduced in later so old releases aren't affected

criterions.comment: imlib2 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.1-2').
